verbs.description: compart (third-person singular simple present comparts, present participle comparting, simple past and past participle comparted)

entries.meaning: (transitive, obsolete) To divide and share with others.
(transitive) To divide into smaller parts; to divide into compartments.
examples: The walls were panelled; each panel was comparted like a modern office desk, and each compartment crowded with labelled folios all filemot with age and use.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To arrange or lay out according to a plan, with due distribution and disposition of parts.
examples: If I behold what inventions men have in comparting Musical intervals...
